Beyond Jiu Jitsu

By Kieren Lefevre and Adam Childs

The Beyond Jiu Jitsu podcast is about all things BJJ, sport, life, health, nutrition, media and beyond. Hosted by Adam Childs, Vantage Jiujitsu BJJ Black Belt under Alliance Head Coach Fabio Gurgel and Kieren Lefevre a BJJ Blue Belt, Personal Trainer, ISSN - Sport Nutrition Specialist, Videographer and Jiu Jitsu Media Influencer.

#139 - BJJ Stars Showdown and Lachlan Giles $100k Grant to Boost Aussie Jiu Jitsu

Join hosts Adam and Kieren in Episode 139 as they dive into the recent BJJ Stars event, exploring the controversy surrounding BJJ black belt superstar Kaynan's disqualification in his match against Mica Galvao for an illegal knee bar. The boys also discuss the generous $100k grant given to Lachlan Giles by a mysterious anonymous donor to help elevate Australian Jiu Jitsu. They'll share insights on the stipulations Lachlan Giles has put on the athlete grants, including his "no PED" rule, and what this could mean for the future of the sport down under. 🎙️ Podcast Links:

#138 - Moving to Sweden & The Journey of a Blue Belt Coach

Welcome to Episode 138 of the Beyond Jiu Jitsu Podcast!


In this episode, Kieren shares his exciting decision to move to Sweden and the challenges he's faced in his journey to try and become a full-time Jiu Jitsu coach at the blue belt level. Adam and Kieren discuss the struggles of making your way through the ranks and the dedication it takes to turn your passion into a career.


Tune in for an inspiring and insightful conversation about pushing boundaries, overcoming obstacles, and the pursuit of Jiu Jitsu excellence. Don't miss this episode packed with valuable lessons and honest reflections!

#136 - Is Rener Gracie a Sellout? The 46 Million Dollar Question

#136 - Is Rener Gracie a Sellout? The 46 Million Dollar Question


In this episode of the Beyond Jiu Jitsu Podcast, we delve into a high-profile and tragic case in the world of BJJ. Our focus is on Rener Gracie's expert testimony in a legal case where a student, Jack Greener, was injured by his instructor, Francisco Iturralde, during a sparring session. This incident led to a neck injury that left Jack quadriplegic with severe and permanent injuries. The case resulted in a payout of 46 million dollars. We explore the details of the case, including the events leading up to the sparring session and the legal proceedings that followed. We also discuss the implications of this case for the BJJ community and the importance of safety measures in training. Join us as we unpack the nuances of this heartbreaking incident and its aftermath in the world of Jiujitsu.

#131 - The Truth About Ecological Jiujitsu: Why It's Hyped Up but Falls Short

Have you heard of ecological jiujitsu? It's been making waves lately, but does it really live up to the hype? In this episode of Beyond Jiu Jitsu, co-hosts Adam Childs and Kieren Lefevre take a deep dive into this teaching method and how it applies to jiujitsu. They discuss why it's gained popularity, but also why it ultimately falls short. With their signature banter and insightful analysis, they uncover the truth about ecological jiujitsu and its limitations in the world of martial arts.

#127 - Position Series 4: Guard

Welcome to Beyond Jiu Jitsu, your go-to source for all things BJJ.

In episode #127 of the show, Kieren and Adam dive into the fourth installment of our Position Series, focusing on the Guard. They discuss broad guard concepts, retention, and tactics, as well as share some drills to help improve your retention. #126 - The Reality of Jiujitsu

#126 - The Reality of Jiujitsu

In this episode of the Beyond Jiu Jitsu Podcast co-hosts Kieren and Adam talk about the reality of jiujitsu and the difficulty of belt progression. Jiujitsu belt progression is a grind and requires significant commitment. Kieren and Adam discuss the importance of having realistic expectations when it comes to progressing through the ranks of jiujitsu. They also talk about the different strategies that can be employed to ensure you stay motivated and focused on your jiujitsu journey.

#125 - Position Series 3: Side Control

#125 - Position Series 3: Side Control  

In this episode of "Beyond Jiu Jitsu," co-hosts Kieren and Adam dive into the world of side control, discussing the pros and cons of the position. They explore attacking and defending from side control, as well as transitioning to other positions.
